intro: Rotala ritchiei, commonly known as the red root or red stem water plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Pontederiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in shallow freshwater habitats such as ponds and wetlands. Its foliage is often used in aquascaping due to its vibrant color and ease of care. Rotala ritchiei produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by distinctive seed pods.
